org.threadly.concurrent.limiter

Class PrioritySchedulerLimiter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.concurrent.limiter.ExecutorLimiter
      • org.threadly.concurrent.limiter.SchedulerLimiter
        • org.threadly.concurrent.limiter.PrioritySchedulerLimiter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Executor, PrioritySchedulerInterface, SimpleSchedulerInterface, SubmitterExecutorInterface, SubmitterSchedulerInterface

    public class PrioritySchedulerLimiter
extends SchedulerLimiter
implements PrioritySchedulerInterface

    This class is designed to limit how much parallel execution happens on a provided PrioritySchedulerInterface. This allows the implementor to have one thread pool for all their code, and if they want certain sections to have less levels of parallelism (possibly because those those sections would completely consume the global pool), they can wrap the executor in this class.

    Thus providing you better control on the absolute thread count and how much parallelism can occur in different sections of the program.

    This is an alternative from having to create multiple thread pools. By using this you also are able to accomplish more efficiently thread use than multiple thread pools would.

    Since:
    1.0.0

      • PrioritySchedulerLimiter

        public PrioritySchedulerLimiter(PrioritySchedulerInterface scheduler,
                        int maxConcurrency)
        Constructs a new limiter that implements the PrioritySchedulerInterface.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - PrioritySchedulerInterface implementation to submit task executions to.
        maxConcurrency - maximum qty of runnables to run in parallel

      • PrioritySchedulerLimiter

        public PrioritySchedulerLimiter(PrioritySchedulerInterface scheduler,
                        int maxConcurrency,
                        java.lang.String subPoolName)
        Constructs a new limiter that implements the PrioritySchedulerInterface.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - PrioritySchedulerInterface implementation to submit task executions to.
        maxConcurrency - maximum qty of runnables to run in parallel
        subPoolName - name to describe threads while tasks running in pool (null to not change thread names)

      • submit

        public ListenableFuture<?> submit(java.lang.Runnable task,
                         TaskPriority priority)
        Description copied from interface: PrioritySchedulerInterface
        Submit a task to run as soon as possible for the given priority. There is a slight increase in load when using submit over execute. So this should only be used when the future is necessary. The future .get() method will return null once the runnable has completed.
        Specified by:
        submit in interface PrioritySchedulerInterface
        Parameters:
        task - runnable to be executed
        priority - priority for task
        Returns:
        a future to know when the task has completed

                          long initialDelay,
                          long recurringDelay,
                          TaskPriority priority)
        Description copied from interface: PrioritySchedulerInterface
        Schedule a recurring task to run and a provided priority. The recurring delay time will be from the point where execution finished.

        Parameters:
        task - runnable to be executed.
        initialDelay - delay in milliseconds until first run.
        recurringDelay - delay in milliseconds for running task after last finish.
        priority - priority for task to run at
